Article.Abstract: Human monoclonal antibodies (MAbs) were selected from semisynthetic antibody phage display libraries by using whole irradiated severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS) coronavirus (CoV) virions as target. We identified eight human MAbs binding to virus and infected cells, six of which could be mapped to two SARS-CoV structural proteins: the nucleocapsid (N) and spike (S) proteins. Two MAbs reacted with N protein. One of the N protein MAbs recognized a linear epitope conserved between all published human and animal SARS-CoV isolates, and the other bound to a nonlinear N epitope. These two N MAbs did not compete for binding to SARS-CoV. Four MAbs reacted with the S glycoprotein, and three of these MAbs neutralized SARS-CoV in vitro. All three neutralizing anti-S MAbs bound a recombinant S1 fragment comprising residues 318 to 510, a region previously identified as the SARS-CoV S receptor binding domain; the nonneutralizing MAb did not. Two strongly neutralizing anti-S1 MAbs blocked the binding of a recombinant S fragment (residues 1 to 565) to SARS-CoV-susceptible Vero cells completely, whereas a poorly neutralizing S1 MAb blocked binding only partially. The MAb ability to block S1-receptor binding and the level of neutralization of the two strongly neutralizing S1 MAbs correlated with the binding affinity to the S1 domain. Finally, epitope mapping, using recombinant S fragments (residues 318 to 510) containing naturally occurring mutations, revealed the importance of residue N479 for the binding of the most potent neutralizing MAb, CR3014. The complete set of SARS-CoV MAbs described here may be useful for diagnosis, chemoprophylaxis, and therapy of SARS-CoV infection and disease.
Article.ArticleTitle: Molecular and biological characterization of human monoclonal antibodies binding to the spike and nucleocapsid proteins of severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus.
Article.Affiliations: Crucell Holland BV, PO Box 2048, 2301 CA Leiden, The Netherlands.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific mAb bound to SARS-CoV-infected Vero cells detected by immunofluorescent staining.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific mAb bound to SARS-CoV N protein N protein by ultrathin-section immuno-EM.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Pepscan analysis with overlapping peptides was used to map the epitope of the mAb. The epitope was deduced based on its presence in the most reactive overlapping peptides.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The ability of the epitope-specific mAb to inhibit S protein interation with Vero cells was examined by FACS. Vero cells were incubated with S-protein-derived fragment aa 1-565 in the presence of the mAb. The mAb did not inhibit binding.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The epitope-specific mAb did not show neutralizing capacity at the normal IgG dilution range; however, subsequent neutralization assays revealed that CR3006 was capable of neutralizing SARS-CoV but only at high concentrations in the micromolar range.

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

To obtain human monoclonal antibodies, scFv-phage display libraries were screened by using whole irradiated SARS coronavirus virions as target. The genes encoding the scFv were recloned and expressed as fully human IgG1 antibody molecules.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: The residues important for binding of the mAb were determined using recombinant fragments of S protein with naturally occurring mutations. No binding was observed to variants bearing mutations at K344, F360, Y442, L472, D480, and T487.
